result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

COUNTS 1 & 2 ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE, with credit for 502 days time served.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 7 years initial confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes:
*Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Eric S. and Albert A.

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TRANSPORTED TO WISCONSIN RESOURCE CENTER (WRC) FORTHWITH.
Order of Commitment for Treatment; signed, filed, and distributed.

Defendant Dante D Ashley in Court with Attorney Joy Malby Bertrand.  Defendant Dante D Ashley in custody.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dante D Ashley appeared by VIDEO CONFERENCE means with Attorney.

Case in Court for Competency Hearing. Parties reviewed Competency Evaluation dated December 11, 2018 and submitted by Dr. Deborah L. Collins. Parties do not contest the Report. Dr. Collins is present in Court; however, parties agreed there is no need for her testimony. Court found Defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand Court proceedings or to assist in his own defense. Court ordered proceedings suspended.  Court ordered Defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame. Court further authorized DHS to administer treatment to Defendant. Discussion placed on the record regarding medications. Court did not issue a decision regarding medications. 
Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the WISCONSIN RESOURCE CENTER (WRC). 
Court ordered case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report, Branch 42. Report is due by June 14, 2019. Defendant to appear via VIDEO CONFERENCE at the next hearing.  
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 21, 2019 at 08:30 am.

per order dated March 14, 2018, Appeal No. 2018XX332-CR, IT IS ORDERED that the state public defender may appoint successor counsel for Ashley within thirty days after the date of this order. See. WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a) (2015-16). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for Ashley's successor counsel to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal on Ashley's behalf is extended through the date sixty days after successor counsel's appointment. See id. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Cornwall shall provide Ashley's successor counsel with a copy of this order. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Ashley's successor counsel shall, within five business days after his or her appointment, file in this court a copy of the state public defender appointment order.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dante D Ashley in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dante D Ashley in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Sherrill A.  

COUNTS 1 & 2 ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 14 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 8 years with credit for 502 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 years.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 10 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 6 years with credit for 502 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 years.


Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Eric S. and Albert A.
*Seek and maintain full time employment to the extent possible.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 7 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarcaration Credit.
Invoice forwarded to accounts payable in the amount of $875.00 to Dr. John Pankiewicz  for services on 08/26/15, 08/25, 08/27/15, 08/28/20115. Copy In File.
Letters on behalf of the defendant, filed.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Dante D Ashley not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing.  Court is in trial.    Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
D288
cf
COURT FILE RETAINED IN COURT.
and Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits, filed.

Defendant Dante D Ashley in court with Jon Gigot under the student practice rule supervised by attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dante D Ashley in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO PHASE 2:
On the same day, at the hour of 2:53 p.m., the jury returned and by their foreperson, Sharon E, brought in the special verdict as follows:

The jury concluded that the defendant was suffering from a mental defect which did not prevent the defendant from conforming his behavior to the requirements of the law.  Dated this 20th day of May, 2016.  Rebecca C, Dissenting Juror."  Filed, Exhibit List, Jury Instructions and Jury questions.   

Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  
 Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dante D Ashley in court with Jon Gigot under the student practice rule supervised by attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dante D Ashley in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

Sheriff Deputy Theep duly sworn for the purpose of deliberations.  Jury in box at 10:29 am as a result of question marked C.    Jury out of box at 10:30 am.  Jury in box at 12:00 as a result of question marked D.  Jury out of box at 12:01 pm.  Court recessed for lunch.  Deliberations to resume at 1:30 in room 632 (Branch 35).

Defendant Dante D Ashley in court with Jon Gigot under the student practice rule supervised by attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dante D Ashley in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Jury in box at 2:05 pm. to review exhibit #12 (QP) as a result of jury question marked A.  Jury out of box at 2:40 pm.  Jurors escorted back to jury room in Branch 35 room 632 for continued deliberations.  Jury in box at 4:08 pm as a result of jury question marked B.  Jury out of box at 4:09 pm.  Jurors escorted back to jury room in Branch 35 room 632 for continued deliberations.  The deputy released the jury for the day.  Case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for May 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dante D Ashley in court with Jon Gigot under the student practice rule supervised by attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dante D Ashley in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juror #15 delayed, in a car accident.  Jury continued deliberations in room 632 (Branch 35) jury room.  Court to start a speedy trial.   Sheriff Deputy S. Urbaniak duly sworn for the purpose of deliberations.   Deputy released jury for lunch at 12:00 pm.

Defendant Dante D Ashley in court with Jon Gigot under the student practice rule supervised by attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dante D Ashley in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Phase 2
Trial continued.  Jury in box at 1:21 pm.  Continued sworn testimony of Dr. Mary Kay Luzi.  Jury out of box at 2:07 pm.  Court held Colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify.  Defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to remain silent and is going to testify.  Jury in box at 2:26 pm.  Sworn for defense: Dante Ashley.  Jury out of box at 2:58 pm.  Jury in box at 3:12 pm.   Defense rests subject to rebuttal.   State rests.  Defense and state rests.  Testimony closed.   Court instructed jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:59 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Fox and Leranth who were previously duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury in box at 4:50 pm.  Jury out of box at 4:51 pm.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 26.

  Jury trial scheduled for May 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dante D Ashley in court with Jon Gigot under the student practice rule supervised by attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dante D Ashley in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Phase 2
Trial continued.  Jury in box at 10:28 am.  Court instructed jury.   Opening statements by defense and state.  Sworn for defense:  Sherrill A.   Sworn for the state:  Dr. Mary Kay Luzi.  Exhibit #11 offered and received.  Jury out of box at 12:00 pm.  Court recessed for lunch.

AS TO PHASE 1:
On the same day, at the hour of 10:06 a.m., the jury returned and by their foreperson, Sharon E, brought in a verdict as follows:

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Dante D. Ashley, GUILTY of Armed Robbery, as charged in Count One of the Information.  Dated this 18th day of May, 2016.  SE, Foreperson."
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Dante D. Ashley, GUILTY of Attempt Armed Robbery, as charged in Count Two of the Information.  Dated this 18th day of May, 2016.  SE, Foreperson."

On direction of the Court, deputy clerk polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Verdict received and filed.  Court discharged the jury.  Court denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court withheld entry of judgment of conviction as to Phase 1.  Jury out of box at 10:11 am.  Filed, Exhibit List, Jury Instructions.

Defendant Dante D Ashley in court with Jon Gigot under the student practice rule supervised by attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dante D Ashley in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial continued.  Jury in box at 8:47 am.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.   Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 9:37 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Fox and Leranth who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Dante D Ashley in court with Jon Gigot under the student practice rule supervised by attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dante D Ashley in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial proceeded.  Jury in box at 1:43 pm.  Continued sworn testimony from Milwaukee Police Sargent Nicholas Kerhin.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Officer Brian Biscobing.  Exhibits  #7, 8, 9, 10  offered and received.  Exhibit 10 published to the jury.  Sidebar.  Jury out of box 2:04 pm.  Jury in box at 2:25 pm.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detective Jason Enk.  Exhibits  #6, 13, 12  offered and received.  Jury out of box at 3:27 pm.  State rests.   Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box at 3:48 pm.  Jury out of box at 3:49 pm.  Court held Colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify.  Defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right to testify.  Jury in box at 3:52 pm.   State rests subject to rebuttal.    Defense rests.   State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box at 3:54 pm.  Jury in box at 4:28 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Jury out of box at 4:50 pm.   Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 26.  Court recessed for the day.  Jury trial scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dante D Ashley in court with Jon Gigot under the student practice rule supervised by attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Dante D Ashley in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn.  Jury list, received and filed.  Jury out of the box at 3:30 pm.  Sidebars placed on the record.

Case recalled at 3:48 pm.  Jury in the box at 3:48 pm. Court instructed the jury on opening instructions of the law.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded. Sworn for the state: Officer Steven Svensson of the Milwaukee Police Department on direct examination.  Exhibits 2 and 3 marked, offered into evidence by state and received by the Court.  Court excused jury for the evening and ordered that they return at 8:45 am, 5/17/16.  Jury out of the box at 4:46 pm.
